body: I'll merge this by end of day ( PST ) if there are no further comments.

Selva, Thanks for comments. Yes, it indicates the status of server-side statement. But nothing impact whatever it's true or false since it'll be set to true after prepare( if it's false, it'll try to close once more.) It has nothing with this issue, so I have set it back. Maybe in the future, it should be separated for the concept of statement status from T2 statement and SQL statement.
Thanks Kevin. I will be merging this PR after the check-PR test passes

Regarding PROCEDURE_TYPE, following is what is described for odbc SQLPROCEDURES. I know this is for Java T2 but could we use the same to distinguish SPJs and UDF ? @zellerh Hans any opinion ?

SQL_PT_UNKNOWN (0): It cannot be determined whether the procedure returns a value.
SQL_PT_PROCEDURE (1): The returned object is a procedure; that is, it does not have a return value.
SQL_PT_FUNCTION (2): The returned object is a function; that is, it has a return value.
Selva faced some problems merging. Will try to merge now.
Looks good to me. There were two Makefile~ files in the first check-in; looks like one of them has been removed but not the other. Perhaps you could remove that in a later check-in?

Yes, I agree, it would be good to set PROCEDURE_TYPE to SQL_PT_PROCEDURE for SPJs and to SQL_PT_FUNCTION for scalar UDFs and TMUDFs. You may need to join the OBJECTS table to the PROCEDURES table to do that. Here is a query I tried:

```
select object_name, object_type, udr_type,
       case when udr_type = 'P' then 1
            when udr_type = 'F' or udr_type = 'T' then 2
            else 0 end procedure_type
from objects join routines
  on objects.object_uid = routines.udr_uid
where object_type = 'UR';
```
I am having permission issues while doing a "git push" right now and unable to merge. The change is ready to be merged.
Don't merge this yet. Found a couple of bugs. (Good thing I continued unit testing after submitting the pull request.)

Yes, the new CQD, if modified, will alter MAX_ESPS_PER_CPU_PER_OP.

Merged. Sandhya, I'm wondering if you were using the wrong password for the "git push"? I use my apache password. Perhaps you were using your github password?
So, I think this can be merged once the tests pass.

Hi Dave,

The test on the most recent rework has passed. See the most recent passed posting after the "add back a missing chunk of code" check-in.

Thanks
Ah, indeed... Does Hans have any more comments? If I hear nothing I'll merge it in the morning.

I had a question above, asking whether that isn't a problem if we need to make a code change to set the AGGRESSIVE_ESP_ALLOCATION_PER_CORE to ON. It's time to get this one behind us, so if you all are ok with the current fix I won't object anymore.
Removed the second erroneous one as well while at it..thanks !

Thanks for the updates Kevin - I'll merge this shortly.

Selva, if there is a concern that user supplied catalog name should only be TRAFODION and the method should error out if not, or it should override the supplied catalog name with TRAFODION then we could fix this for all APIs via a separate JIRA. Hope that is ok.

Kevin, do please plan to add unit tests as part of JIRA TRAFODION-1741 or a separate JIRA to cover these new APIs for JDBC.
Merging this shortly if there are no further comments.
I think this is ready to merge.
Looks good to me. Code is simpler than before. And I imagine will be less tedious to debug.
Some differences noted between the version tested on AWS and this. Will merge after the change is checked in.

Looks OK to me. I take it the fix to the bug is the change in TransactionRegionLocation.java, while the other changes are simply to give more logging detail?
Thanks Dave.  You're correct.  The real fix is to realize that if a new region's start and end keys are contained withing the existing region's start and end keys it is the same region.
Looks good to me. But, do you think we should do the same with other callers of getObjectUID?

Thanks Narendra.
